tn.ref: the third year of Cyrus king of Persia
tn.text: "year 3 of the rule of Cyrus the king of Persia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: a message was revealed to Daniel
tn.text: This can also be expressed in active form. AT: "God revealed a message to Daniel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"understanding"
These are expensive or rare kinds of food. AT: "fancy foods"

tn.ref: until the completion of three entire weeks
tn.text: "until the end of three entire weeks"

tn.ref: On the twenty-fourth day of the first month
tn.text: fourth day of the first month** - This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-fourth day is near the middle of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: with a belt around his waist
tn.text: "and he was wearing a belt"
Uphaz is a place. Its location is not known (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
His body gleamed with blue or yellow light as if it were made of topaz. AT: "his body gleamed like topaz" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a blue or yellow gemstone, also known as beryl, peridot, or chrysolite
His face shone brightly as a bolt of lightning shines. AT: "his face shone with light as bright as the flash of lightning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: His eyes were like flaming torches
tn.text: His eyes were bright with light as if they were flaming torches. AT: "his eyes were so bright that it seemed they had torches burning inside them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: his arms and his feet were like polished bronze
tn.text: His arms and feet were as shiny as if they were made of polished bronze. AT: "his arms and feet shone like polished bronze that reflects the light around it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: The sound of his words was like the sound of a great crowd
tn.text: His voice was so loud that it was as if a crowd of people were all talking loudly. AT: "his voice was as loud as a huge crowd all calling out together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: So I was left alone and saw
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. "No one was with me, and I saw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: my bright appearance was turned into a ruined look
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. "my bright appearance turned into looking ruined" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This describes the face of someone who is healthy. AT: "my healthy-looking face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Someone's unhealthy, pale face is spoken of as if it were a ruined building. AT: "pale" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This implies that someone was speaking in the vision. This can be made explicit. AT: "I heard the words of someone who was speaking." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I fell on my face in deep sleep
tn.text: Possible meanings are: 1) Daniel was so scared by what he saw that he deliberately laid on the ground, where he then fainted or 2) Daniel fainted and then fell forward onto the ground. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This implies metonymy, where a person's hand represents that person, probably the man whom Daniel saw in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:10:04|10:5-6]]. AT: "Someone touched me with his hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can also be stated in active form. AT: "Daniel, you whom God greatly treasures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
much valued and loved

tn.ref: you set your mind to understand
tn.text: "you determined to understand the vision"
This can be expressed in active form. AT: "God heard your words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here this refers to a spirit who has authority over a human nation. AT: "spirit prince"
This probably refers to the various kings who ruled over nations in the Persian Empire, and who had to obey the king of Persia.

tn.ref: Michael, one of the chief princes
tn.text: "Michael, on of the chief angels" or "Michael, one of the archangels"
The angel continues speaking to Daniel.

tn.ref: I turned my face toward the ground
tn.text: "I looked at the ground." Daniel may have done this to show humble reverence, or because he was afraid.

tn.ref: One who was like the sons of man
tn.text: This may refer to the one who had just spoken to Daniel. However, some versions interpret it as referring to a different person. AT: "This one, who looked like a human"
Here this expression refers to human beings in general. AT: "like a human being" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
severe emotional suffering

tn.ref: I am your servant. How can I talk with my master?
tn.text: Daniel asks this question meaning that he cannot speak to the angel because he is not the angel's equal. These sentences can be combined. AT: "I am not able to answer you because I am only your servant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: there is no breath left in me
tn.text: This idiom refers to breathing. AT: "I cannot breathe" or "it's very hard to breathe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]).

tn.ref: the one with an appearance of a man
tn.text: "the one who looked like a human"
The words "be strong" are repeated for emphasis.
This can also be stated in active form. AT: "you whom God greatly treasures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can also be stated in active form. AT: "I became strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "prince" refers to a spirit who rules and guards a human nation. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:dan:10:12|10:13]]. AT: "the spirit prince of Persia"
This implies that the angel will tell Daniel about this immediately, before he goes away. AT: "But first I will tell you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: what is written in The Book of Truth
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what The Book of Truth says" or "what someone wrote in The Book of Truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: who shows himself to be strong
tn.text: "who proves himself to be strong"

tn.ref: There is no one who shows himself to be strong with me against them, except Michael your prince
tn.text: "Michael your prince is the only one to show himself strong with me against them" or "Michael your prince is the only one who helps me against them"
The word "your" is plural. It refers to Daniel and the rest of the people of Israel. AT: "Michael, the prince of your people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"Michael your guardian angel." Translate "prince" when it refers to Michael as you did [[:en:bible:notes:dan:10:12|10:13]].
